--- title: "1.11 — New Trade Theory I — Class Content" execute: freeze: auto --- ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"} # Meeting Date *Tuesday, February 28, 2023* ::: ::: callout-warning # Upcoming Assignment [Problem Set 2](/assignment/02-problem-set) (1.9-1.12) is due by 11:59 PM Thursday March 9 on Blackboard Assignments. ::: ## Overview Today, we begin New Trade Theory. ## Readings - Chapter 6.4 in Feenstra & Taylor We will cover 6.1-6.2 next class. I also strongly suggest you consume Paul Krugman’s [2008 Economics Nobel Prize address](https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/economic-sciences/2008/krugman/lecture/) in some format. There is a video, his slides, and his written lecture posted there. I will be drawing from some of that today. # Primary Sources Mentioned: - [ Krugman (1980), “Scale Economies, Product Differentiation, and Pattern of Trade”](/files/readings/Krugman-1980.pdf) ## Slides Below, you can find the slides in two formats. Clicking the image will bring you to the html version of the slides in a new tab. The lower button will allow you to download a PDF version of the slides. ::: callout-tip You can type h to see a special list of viewing options, and type o for an outline view of all the slides. ::: I suggest printing the slides beforehand and using them to take additional notes in class (*not everything* is in the slides)!

Download as PDF

## Assignments ### Problem Set 2 Due Thursday February 23 [Problem Set 2](/assignment/02-problem-set) (1.1-1.8) is due by 11:59 PM Thursday February 23 on Blackboard Assignments.
